channel.title: About on Fueled by Cofee
channel.description: Recent content in About on Fueled by Cofee

item.title: How we ran a Unix-like OS (Xv6), on our home-built CPU with our home-built C compiler
item.description: Have you ever designed your own ISA, built a processor of that ISA on FPGA, and built a compiler for it? Furthermore, have you run an operating system on that processor? Actually, we have. In this post, I’m going to talk about my undergraduate days in 2015, our four months of building a home-built CPU of a home-built RISC ISA, building a home-built C toolchain, and porting Xv6, a Unix-like OS, to that CPU.
